name: KOI-351
scenarioDescription:
The KOI-351 Exoplanetary System


Overview

KOI-351 is a star with 1.2 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.2 times its radius. It is located 2544.02 light years away from the solar system.

KOI-351 is known to have 8 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KOI-351 system


KOI-351 b

KOI-351 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 b is 1.31 that of Earth.


KOI-351 c

KOI-351 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 c is 1.19 that of Earth.


KOI-351 d

KOI-351 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.32 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 d is 2.87 that of Earth.


KOI-351 e

KOI-351 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.42 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 e is 2.66 that of Earth.


KOI-351 f

KOI-351 f was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.48 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 f is 2.88 that of Earth.


KOI-351 g

KOI-351 g was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.71 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 g is 8.1 that of Earth.


KOI-351 h

KOI-351 h was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 1.01 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of KOI-351 h is 11.3 that of Earth.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system KOI-351, which contains 8 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
